title: Intercepts from a table
description: Sal finds the y-intercept of the graph of a linear function given a table of values.

title: Constructing angles
description: Sal uses a protractor to create 10° and 155° angles.

title: Angles: introduction
description: Two rays that share the same endpoint form an angle. Learn about angles and the parts of an angle, like the vertex.

title: Adding fractions word problem: paint
description: Sal solves a word problem by adding mixed numbers with unlike denominators.

title: Subtracting fractions word problem: tomatoes
description: Sal solves a word problem by subtracting mixed numbers with unlike denominators.

title: Irregular plural nouns – words that end in -en
description: The plural of "whale" is "whales", but what's the plural of "child"? David, Khan Academy's resident grammarian, explains.

title: Fundamentals: Justification and Explanation
description:
The concept of justification is fundamental to good, careful thinking. But what does it mean for a belief or action to be justified? In this video, Kelley sheds some light on how to assess whether a belief and action is justified. She also clarifies the notion of justification by distinguishing it from explanation and explaining its relationship to the practice of giving reasons.

Speaker: Kelley Schiffman, Yale University

title: Statistics intro: Mean, median, & mode
description: The mean (average) of a data set is found by adding all numbers in the data set and then dividing by the number of values in the set. The median is the middle value when a data set is ordered from least to greatest. The mode is the number that occurs most often in a data set.

title: Missing value given the mean
description: Learn how to find the value of a missing piece of data if you know the mean of the data set.

title: Comparing fractions with the same denominator
description: Lindsay compares fractions with the same denominator. She compares one pair of fractions with visuals and another pair without visuals.

title: Comparing fractions with the same numerator
description: Lindsay compares fractions with the same numerator. She compares one pair of fractions with visuals and another pair without visuals.

title: Comparing fractions with > and < symbols
description: Sal shades visual fraction models to compare fractions.

title: Right triangle word problem
description: Sal solves a modeling problem where he finds the necessary angle to shoot at a vicious alien.

title: Volume of a cone
description: The formula for the volume of a cone is V=1/3hπr². Learn how to use this formula to solve an example problem.

title: Cylinder volume & surface area
description: A cylinder's volume is π r² h, and its surface area is 2π r h + 2π r². Learn how to use these formulas to solve an example problem.

title: Dividing polynomials with remainders
description: Sal divides (x^3+5x-4) by (x^2-x+1) using long division.

title: Intro to long division of polynomials
description: Any quotient of polynomials a(x)/b(x) can be written as q(x)+r(x)/b(x), where the degree of r(x) is less than the degree of b(x). For example, (x²-3x+5)/(x-1) can be written as x-2+3/(x-1). This latter form can be more useful for many problems that involve polynomials. The most common method for finding how to rewrite quotients like that is *polynomial long division*.

title: Sample spaces for compound events
description: Explore the notion of a "sample space". See a sample space represented as a tree diagram, table, and list.

title: Interpreting a graph example
description: Learn to interpret the graphs of a linear functions.

title: Adding & subtracting rational numbers: 79% - 79.1 - 58 1/10
description: Sal evaluates 79% - 79.1 - 58 1/10.

title: Adding & subtracting rational numbers: 0.79 - 4/3 - 1/2 + 150%
description: Sal evaluates 0.79 - 4/3 - 1/2 + 150%.

title: Adding & subtracting fractions
description: Add and subtract negative fractions with unlike denominators.

title: Time word problem: travel time
description: Sal solves what time do you leave if you are traveling 39 minutes and need to be home at 6:15.

title: Time word problem: puzzle
description: Lindsay finds out how long it took to solve a puzzle when given the start and finish time.

title: Estimating the line of best fit exercise
description: Sal solves a problem where he has to estimate the line of best fit for a scatter plot.

title: Fitting a line to data
description: Sal creates a scatter plot and then fits a line to data on the median California family income.

title: Multiplying challenging decimals
description: Sometimes multiplying really small decimals (with all those zeros!) can be a little intimidating. Watch as we show you a handy trick to simplify these problems and solve them.

title: Multiplying decimals example
description: To multiply decimals, first multiply as if there is no decimal. Next, count the number of digits after the decimal in each factor. Finally, put the same number of digits behind the decimal in the product. For example, if we multiply 7.61✕9.2, we will have 3 digits behind the decimal in our product because there are 3 digits behind the decimals in the factors.

title: DNA replication and RNA transcription and translation
description: How DNA is copied (replication). How information in DNA can be used to make a protein.

title: Alleles and genes
description: A gene as a stretch of DNA on a chromosome. Alleles as versions (sequence variants) of a gene.

title: Dividing a whole number by a decimal
description: When dividing a whole number by a decimal, you're going to need to change that decimal into a whole number. How? We'll show you.

title: Dividing by a multi-digit decimal
description: Sal shows that when there is a decimal divisor, you need to shift the decimal first and then divide.

title: Dividing decimals with hundredths example 3
description: Sal shows how to  tackle a division problem step by step when there is a decimal divisor.

title: Cancer
description: An introduction to what cancer is and how it is the by-product of broken DNA replication.

title: Phases of meiosis I
description: How homologous chromosomes separate into two sets. Prophase I, metaphase I, anaphase I, and telophase I.

title: Phases of meiosis II
description: How sister chromatids separate to form gametes. Prophase II, metaphase II, anaphase II, telophase II.

title: Chromosomal crossover in meiosis I
description: How homologous chromosomes exchange fragments in prophase I. Tetrads, chiasmata, and alleles.

title: Mitosis
description: Mitosis is how cells divide! Learn what happens in all the phases of mitosis: prophase, metaphase, anaphase, and telophase.

title: Interphase
description: Interphase of the cell cycle, including G₁, S, and G₂ phases. How the cell replicates its DNA before mitosis.

title: Chromosomes, chromatids and chromatin
description: Overview of DNA transcription, translation, and replication during mitosis and meiosis. Learn about chromosomes, chromatids, and chromatin.

title: Fertilization terminology: gametes, zygotes, haploid, diploid
description: How haploid gametes (sperm and egg cells) combine to form a diploid zygote with two sets of chromosomes.

title: Evaluating an expression with one variable
description: Learn how to evaluate an expression with variables using a technique called substitution (or "plugging in").

title: Evaluating expressions with variables: temperature
description: In this example we have a formula for converting Celsius temperature to Fahrenheit. Let's substitute the variable with a value (Celsius temp) to get the degrees in Fahrenheit. Great problem to practice with us!

title: Evaluating expressions with variables: cubes
description: In this example of evaluating expressions, we're dusting off some geometry. On top of that, it's a word problem. We're seeing how different concepts in math are layered on top of each to create more interesting and complex problems to solve.

title: Special right triangles intro (part 1)
description: Introduction to 45-45-90 Triangles

title: Special right triangles intro (part 2)
description: A few more 45-45-90 triangle examples and an introduction to 30-60-90 triangles.

title: Noncompetitive inhibition
description: Seeing how a noncompetitive inhibitor can bind whether or not the substrate is bound, and vice versa.

title: 5 human impacts on the environment
description: Hank presents examples of how human activity can affect ecosystems.

title: Pollution
description: Hank discusses different forms of pollution and their ecological effects.

title: Dividing whole numbers & fractions: t-shirts
description: Dividing a whole number by a fraction? Turn the tables and multiply by the reciprocal of the fraction. Boom!

title: Dividing whole numbers by fractions: word problem
description: Learn to solve a word problem that involves dividing a whole number by a unit fraction.

title: Comparing linear functions: equation vs. graph
description: Sal is given the formula of a linear function and the graph of another, and is asked to determine which function increases faster.

title: Comparing linear functions: table vs. graph
description: Sal is given a table of values of a linear function and four linear graphs, and is asked to determine which graph has the same rate of change as the function represented in the table.

title: Comparing linear functions: table vs. graph
description: Sal is given a table of values of a linear function and four linear graphs, and is asked to determine which graph increases faster than the function represented in the table.

title: Factoring perfect squares: common factor
description: Sal factors 16x^3+24x^2+9x as (x)(4x+3)^2.

title: Factoring perfect squares: missing values
description: Sal analyzes the factorization of x^2+5x+c as (x+d)^2 to find the values of the missing coefficients c and d.

title: Factoring perfect squares: shared factors
description: Sal finds the binomial factor shared by 4x^2+12x+9 and 4x^2-9.

title: Derivatives of inverse functions: from equation
description: Given that f(x)=½x³+3x-4, Sal evaluates the derivative of the inverse of f at x=-14.

title: Derivatives of inverse functions: from table
description: Given a table of values of g, its inverse h, and its derivative g', Sal evaluates the derivative of the inverse, h', at a given x-value.

title: Area between curves
description: By integrating the difference of two functions, you can find the area between them.

title: Area between curves with multiple boundaries
description: Here we go through a slightly more involved problem finding the area between different functions.

title: Comparing decimals 3
description: Sal compares decimals like 45.675 and 45.645 with greater and less than symbols.

title: Comparing decimals: 156.378 and 156.348
description: Sal compares 2 decimals using place value.

title: Comparing decimals: 9.97 and 9.798
description: Sal compares 9.97 and 9.798 using place value.

title: Finding reasonable unit of measurement example
description: Sal chooses reasonable units of time activities like baking cookies.

title: Powers of products & quotients (integer exponents)
description: For any integers a and b and for any exponents n, (a⋅b)ⁿ=aⁿ⋅bⁿ and (a/b)ⁿ=aⁿ/bⁿ. These are worked examples for using these properties with integer exponents.

title: Place value for decimals greater than 1
description: Sal discusses decimal numbers that are greater than 1.

title: Canceling zeros when dividing
description: Lindsay breaks down division problems involving multiples of 10.

title: Johannes Vermeer, Woman Holding a Balance
description:
Johannes Vermeer, Woman Holding a Balance, 1664, oil on canvas, 42.5 cm × 38 cm / 16.7 in × 15 in (National Gallery of Art)

Speakers: Dr. Steven Zucker and Dr. Beth Harris

title: Derivative of a position vector valued function
description: Visualizing the derivative of a position vector valued function

title: Dividing whole numbers by 10
description: Lindsay finds a pattern from dividing whole numbers by 10.

title: Finding features of quadratic functions
description: Sal finds the zeros, the vertex, & the line of symmetry of quadratic functions given in vertex form, factored form, & standard form.

title: Quotients that are multiples of 10
description: Lindsay breaks down division problems using multiples of 10.

title: Area of trapezoids
description: Area of a trapezoid is found with the formula, A=(a+b)/2 x h.  Learn how to use the formula to find area of trapezoids.

title: Graphs of nonlinear piecewise functions
description: Sal is given the graph of a piecewise function and several possible formulas. He determines which is the correct formula.

title: Statistical questions
description: What makes a question a "statistical question"?

title: Dividing complex numbers: polar & exponential form
description: Sal shows how complex division affects the modulus and the argument of the divisor and the dividend.

title: Negative numbers, variables, number line
description: Given a, b, and c shown on the number line, Sal determines if statements like -b < c are true.

title: Interquartile range (IQR)
description: The IQR describes the middle 50% of values when ordered from lowest to highest. To find the interquartile range (IQR), ​first find the median (middle value) of the lower and upper half of the data. These values are quartile 1 (Q1) and quartile 3 (Q3). The IQR is the difference between Q3 and Q1.

title: Simplifying expressions
description: We've learned about order of operations and combining like terms. Let's layer the distributive property on top of this.

title: Worked example: evaluating expressions with function notation
description: Evaluating -2⋅f(-6)+g(1) given the graphs of f and g.

title: Foci of a hyperbola from equation
description: Sal discusses the foci of hyperbolas and shows how they relate to hyperbola equations.

title: Korean War overview
description: The origins and progress of the Korean War.

title: Identifying numerators and denominators
description: Sal identifying numerators and denominators in fractions.

title: Area enclosed by a polar formula
description: Develop intuition for the area enclosed by polar graph formula

title: Area enclosed by cardioid
description: Area enclosed by cardioid

title: Area between two polar graphs
description: More practice with the area encloised by polar functions, this time with two graphs.

title: Evaluating definite integral with calculator
description: Here we walk through how to use a graphing calculator to compute the integral found in the last video.

title: Converting percents to decimals & fractions example
description: Sal writes 18% as a decimal and as a fraction.

title: Rounding whole numbers to nearest hundred
description: Sal rounds 24,259 to the nearest hundred.

title: Rounding whole numbers to nearest thousand
description: Sal rounds 423,275 to the  nearest thousand.

title: Rounding whole numbers to nearest ten
description: Sal rounds 1585 to the nearest ten.

title: Worked example: average rate of change from table
description: Finding the average rate of change of a function over the interval -5<x<-2, given a table of values of the function.

title: Worked example: average rate of change from graph
description: Finding the interval in a function's graph where the function has an average rate of change of -4.

title: Comparing rates example
description: Sal puts three fish tanks in order by volume of water per fish.

title: Solving unit rate problem
description: Jayda takes 3 hours to deliver newspapers on her route. What is the rate per hour at which she delivers the newspapers?

title: Solving unit price problem
description: Miranda's Maid Service charges \$280 to clean 8 offices. What is the company's price for cleaning a single office?

title: Worked example: quadratic formula
description: Solving 6x²+3=2x-6 by rewriting in standard form and identifying the parameters a, b, and c, that can be used within the quadratic formula.

title: Worked example: quadratic formula (example 2)
description: Sal solves the equation -x^2+8x=1 by first bringing it to standard form and then using the quadratic formula.

title: Worked example: quadratic formula (negative coefficients)
description: Sal solves -3x^2+10x-3=0 by plugging a=-3, b=10, c=-3 in the quadratic formula. Then he multiplies everything by -1 and solves again. The results are the same!

title: Scientific notation example: 0.0000000003457
description: Can you imagine if you had to do calculations with very, very small numbers? How would you handle all those zeros to the right of the decimal? Thank goodness for scientific notation!

title: Scientific notation examples
description: Scientific notation is a way of writing very large or very small numbers. A number is written in scientific notation when a number between 1 and 10 is multiplied by a power of 10. For example, 650,000,000 can be written in scientific notation as 6.5 ✕ 10^8.

title: Find measure of vertical angles
description: Given two intersecting lines and the measure of vertical angles, watch as we solve to find the measure of the remaining angles.

title: Complementary & supplementary angles
description: Learn about complementary and supplementary angles, as well as the definitions of adjacent and straight angles.

title: Interpreting units in formulas
description: Sal finds an appropriate measurement unit for Power given the formula P=W/t where P is Power, W is Work, and t is Time.

title: Interpreting units in formulas: novel units
description: Sal finds an appropriate measurement unit for carrot yield given the formula Y=2C/P where Y is yield, C is # of carrots, and P is # of plants.

title: Common denominators: 1/2 and 1/3
description: Lindsay uses fraction models and multiplication to find common denominators for 1/2 and 1/3.

title: Common denominators: 3/5 and 7/2
description: Lindsay uses fraction models and multiplication to find common denominators for 3/5 and 7/2.

title: Common denominators: 1/4 and 5/6
description: Lindsay uses fraction models and multiplication to find common denominators for 1/4 and 5/6.

title: Finding common denominators
description: Rewrite 2/8 and 5/6 to have the same denominator.

title: Solving sinusoidal equations of the form sin(x)=d
description: Sal finds the expressions that together represent all possible solutions to the equation sin(x)=1/3.

title: Solving cos(θ)=1 and cos(θ)=-1
description: Sal solves the equations cos(θ)=1 and cos(θ)=-1 using the graph of y=cos(θ).

title: Graphing basic logarithmic functions
description: Sal graphs y=log_5(x).

title: Graphs of logarithmic functions
description: Sal is given a graph of a logarithmic function with four possible formulas, and finds the appropriate one.

title: Evaluating logarithms: change of base rule
description: Sal approximates log₅(100) by rewriting it as log(100)/log(5) using the change of base rule, then evaluates with a calculator.

title: Plotting maxima, minima and midline intersections of trig function
Graph of y=tan(x)
description: Sal draws the graph of the tangent function based on the unit circle definition of the function.

title: Finding a sinusoidal function from its graph
description: Sal determines a function of the form y=a*sin(bx) or y=a*cos(bx) based on the graph of the function.

title: Transforming sinusoidal graphs: vertical stretch & horizontal reflection
description: Sal graphs y=2*sin(-x) by considering it as a vertical stretch and a horizontal reflection of y=sin(x).

title: Transforming sinusoidal graphs: vertical & horizontal stretches
description: Sal graphs y=-2.5*cos(1/3*x) by considering it as a vertical stretch and reflection, and a horizontal stretch, of y=cos(x).

title: VSEPR for 2 electron clouds
description: Definition of VSEPR and examples of molecules with two electron clouds.

title: VSEPR for 4 electron clouds
description: VSEPR for molecules with four electron clouds including examples for tetrahedral, trigonal pyramidal, and bent molecules.

title: VSEPR for 3 electron clouds
description: VSEPR for three electron clouds including examples for trigonal planar and bent molecules.

title: Dipole moment
description: Predicting the molecular dipole moment based on the molecular geometry.

title: sp³ hybridization
description: sp³ hybrid orbitals and properties of sigma bonds.

title: Sp hybridization
description: In sp hybridization, the 2s orbital and a 2p orbital hybridize to form two sp orbitals, each consisting of 50% s character and 50% p character. The front lobes point away from each other (creating ​a 180° angle between the two orbitals), and the back lobes also point in opposite directions. This results in a linear structure.

title: Recognizing functions from graph
description: Checking whether a given set of points can represent a function. For the set to represent a function, each domain element must have one corresponding range element at most.

title: Does a vertical line represent a function?
description: Explaining why a vertical line doesn't represent a function.

title: Inverting a 3x3 matrix using Gaussian elimination
description: Sal explains how we can find the inverse of a 3x3 matrix using Gaussian elimination.

title: Inverting a 3x3 matrix using determinants Part 1: Matrix of minors and cofactor matrix
description: Sal shows how to find the inverse of a 3x3 matrix using its determinant. In Part 1 we learn how to find the matrix of minors of a 3x3 matrix and its cofactor matrix.

title: Inverting a 3x3 matrix using determinants Part 2: Adjugate matrix
description: Sal shows how to find the inverse of a 3x3 matrix using its determinant. In Part 2 we complete the process by finding the determinant of the matrix and its adjugate matrix.

title: Partial sums intro
description: The partial sum of an infinite series as the sum of the first few terms (and hence it's only partial). This seemingly simple concept is very useful in thinking about infinite series.

title: Partial sums: formula for nth term from partial sum
description: The partial sum of a sequence gives as the sum of the first n terms in the sequence. If we know the formula for the partial sums of a sequence, we can find a formula for the nth term in the sequence.

title: Partial sums: term value from partial sum
description: The partial sum of a sequence gives as the sum of the first n terms in the sequence. If we know the formula for the partial sums of a sequence, we can find the value of any term in the sequence.

title: Multiplying: 2-digit by 1-digit (regrouping)
description: Sal solves 6x37.

title: Multiplying 3-digit by 1-digit (regrouping)
description: Learn to multiply a 3-digit number by a 1-digit number using regrouping.  In this video, we will multiply 7x253.

title: Multiplying 4-digit by 1-digit (regrouping)
description: Learn to multiply a 4-digit number by a 1-digit number.  In this video, we will multiply 8085 times 9.

title: Ordering expressions
description: Let's get some practice thinking about adding and subtracting variables representing positive and negative numbers on the number line.

title: Flow of energy and matter through ecosystems
description: Seeing how energy and matter flows and is recycled from primary producers (autotrophs) to primary, secondary and tertiary consumers.

title: Interactions between populations
description: Learn about the many types of interspecific interactions: competition, predation, herbivory, symbiosis, parasitism, mutualism, commensalism.

title: Types of immune responses: Innate and adaptive, humoral vs. cell-mediated
description: Innate vs. adaptive immunity. Humoral adaptive immunity vs. cell-mediated adaptive immunity.

title: Uncle Tom's Cabin - influence of the Fugitive Slave Act
description: How could a novel start a war? KA's US history fellow Kim and US history intern Becca discuss the growing sectional conflict in the 1850s that surrounded the publication of Harriet Beecher Stowe's novel Uncle Tom's Cabin.

title: Uncle Tom's Cabin - plot and analysis
description: What actually happened in the novel Uncle Tom's Cabin that so affected nineteenth century audiences? Kim and Becca discuss the plot and social implications of Uncle Tom's Cabin.

title: Uncle Tom's Cabin - reception and significance
description: How did Northerners, Southerners, and the international community receive Harriet Beecher Stowe's abolitionist novel? Kim and Becca discuss the reception and far-reaching consequences of the novel Uncle Tom's Cabin.

title: Teens as sums with 10
description: Sal looks at the 1 in each teen number and thinks about what it really means.

title: Teen numbers: monkeys
description: Sal breaks the number 18 into 10 and 8.

title: Points and quadrants example
description: Plot an ordered pair like (-4, -2) and then decide which quadrant it is in.

title: Quadrants of the coordinate plane
description: Learn about the 4 quadrants that make up a coordinate plane.

title: Understanding fractions as division
description: Sal shows how a/b and a÷b are equivalent. That is, the fraction bar and the division symbol mean the same thing.

title: Prepositions of space
description: Some prepositions help describe relationships between objects and their locations in space. David explains how!

title: Prepositions of time
description: Some prepositions help describe moments in time. Learn more and enhance your powers of time wizardry!

title: Extending geometric sequences
description: Sal finds the next term in the geometric sequence -1/32, 1/8, -1/2, 2,...

title: Number opposites
description: Learn about number opposites like 3 and -3 or -4 and 4 using a number line.

title: Representing data
description: Here are a few of the many ways to look at data. Which is your favorite?

title: Line plot distribution: trail mix
description: Sal uses different bags of trail mix to find the amount of trail mix each bag would contain if the total amount in all the bags were redistributed equally.

title: Worked example: Rounding decimals to nearest tenth
description: Learn to round 9.564 to the nearest tenth.

title: Worked example: Rounding decimals to nearest tenth
description: Learn to round 9.564 to the nearest tenth.

title: Division strategies for decimal quotients
description: Sal uses an understanding of place value and fractions to introduce dividing with decimals.

title: Multi-digit division strategies for decimals
description: Sal uses understanding of place value, expanded form, and fractions to help divide with decimals.

title: Horizontally launched projectile
description: In this video David explains how to solve for the horizontal displacement when the projectile starts with a horizontal initial velocity. He also explains common mistakes people make when doing horizontally launched projectile problems.

title: Ways to arrange colors
description: Thinking about how many ways you can pick four colors from a group of 6

title: Ways to pick officers
description: How many ways can we pick officers for our organization?

title: Zero product property
description: The zero product property states that if a⋅b=0 then either a or b equal zero. This basic property helps us solve equations like (x+2)(x-5)=0.

title: Pressure and Pascal's principle (part 2)
description: Sal finishes the calculation or work to determine the mechanical advantage in a U-shaped tube. He also explains pressure and Pascal's Principal.

title: Pressure and Pascal's principle (part 1)
description: Sal explains the difference between liquids and gasses (both fluids). He then starts a calculation of the work done on a liquid in a U-shaped container.

title: Pressure at a depth in a fluid
description: Sal derives the formula to determine the pressure at a specific depth in a fluid.

title: Archimedes principle and buoyant force
description: Introduction to Archimedes' principle and buoyant force.

title: Buoyant force example problems
description: A couple of problems involving Archimedes' principle and buoyant forces.

title: Volume flow rate and equation of continuity
description: Sal introduces the notion of moving fluids and laminar flow. Then he uses the incompressibility of a liquid to show that the volume flow rate (flux) must remain constant. Sal then derives the equation of continuity in terms of the area and speed.

title: Bernoulli's equation (part 1)
description: This is the first of two videos where Sal derives Bernoulli's equation.

title: Bernoulli's equation (part 2)
description: This is the second of two videos where Sal derives Bernoulli's equation. In the second half of the video Sal also begins an example problem where liquid exits a hole in a container.

title: Bernoulli's equation (part 3)
description: Sal finishes the example problem where liquid exits a hole in a container.

title: Bernoulli's equation (part 4)
description: Clarification of, and more thoughts on, the Bernoulli's equation example problem where liquid exits a hole in a container.

title: Bernoulli's example problem
description: Sal solves a Bernoulli's equation example problem where fluid is moving through a pipe of varying diameter.

title: Dependent probability introduction
description: Let's get you started with a great explanation of dependent probability using a scenario involving a casino game.

title: Dependent probability: coins
description: We're thinking about how the probability of an event can be dependent on another event occuring in this example problem.

title: Independent & dependent probability
description: This time around we're not going to tell you whether we're working on a dependent or independent probability event problem. You tell us!

title: Dependent probability example
description: It's important to practice these probability problems as they get more complex eventually. Take a stab on this one...with our help, of course.

title: The Monty Hall problem
description: Here we have a presentation and analysis of the famous thought experiment: the "Monty Hall" problem! This is fun.

title: Strategies for dividing by tenths
description: Sal uses equivalent fractions to divide both whole numbers and decimals by tenths.

title: Division strategies for decimal quotients
description: Sal uses an understanding of place value and fractions to introduce dividing with decimals.

title: Multi-digit division strategies for decimals
description: Sal uses understanding of place value, expanded form, and fractions to help divide with decimals.

title: Multi-digit division strategies for decimals
description: Sal uses understanding of place value, expanded form, and fractions to help divide with decimals.

title: Division strategies for decimal quotients
description: Sal uses an understanding of place value and fractions to introduce dividing with decimals.

title: DNA replication and RNA transcription and translation
description: How DNA is copied (replication). How information in DNA can be used to make a protein.

title: Molecular structure of triglycerides (fats)
description: Understanding how a triglyceride (triacylglycerol) can be formed from a glycerol molecule and three fatty acids.

title: Molecular structure of DNA
description: Molecular structure of DNA. Nucleotide. Nitrogenous base, phosphate.

title: Hydrolysis
description: How hydrolysis can break down polysaccharides (carbohydrates) like starch, cellulose, chitin and glycogen.

title: Dehydration synthesis or a condensation reaction
description: Dehydration synthesis (condensation reaction) between sugar molecules. Monosaccharides, disaccharides, and polysaccharides. Formation of maltose from glucose monomers.

title: Saturated fats, unsaturated fats, and trans fats
description: Saturated fats, unsaturated fats, and trans fats.

title: Overview of protein structure
description: Primary, secondary, tertiary and quaternary protein structure. Beta pleated sheets and alpha helices.

title: Introduction to amino acids
description: Amino acids and the central dogma of molecular biology. Amino and carboxyl groups, side chains, and zwitterions.

title: Manipulating formulas: perimeter
description: Sal rewrites the formula for the perimeter of a rectangle so it is solved for width.

title: Manipulating formulas: temperature
description: Sal takes the formula for converting from Fahrenheit temperature to Celsius, and solves it for F so it serves to convert from Celsius to Fahrenheit.

title: Manipulating formulas: area
description: Sal rewrites the formula for the area of a triangle so it is solved for height.

title: Intro to grouping
description: Sal introduces the method of grouping, which is very useful in factoring quadratics whose leading coefficient is not 1.

title: Factoring quadratics by grouping
description: Sal factors 4y^2+4y-15 as (2y-3)(2y+5) by grouping.

title: Dividing whole numbers by fractions: word problem
description: Learn to solve a word problem that involves dividing a whole number by a unit fraction.

title: Dividing fractions by whole numbers: studying
description: Learn to solve a word problem that involves dividing a unit fraction by a whole number.

title: Greatest common factor of monomials
description: Sal finds the greatest common factor of 10cd^2 and 25c^3d^2.

title: Congruent shapes & transformations
description: Sal shows that a given pair of pentagons are congruent by mapping one onto the other using rigid transformations.

title: Non-congruent shapes & transformations
description: Sal shows that a given pair of pentagons are not congruent by showing it's not possible to map one onto the other using rigid transformations.

title: Equivalent expressions: negative numbers & distribution
description: Learn how to identify equivalent expressions using your knowledge of the distributive property and negative numbers.

title: Applying the fundamental theorem of calculus
description: See what the fundamental theorem of calculus looks like in action.

title: Slightly trickier fundamental theorem problem
description: Sometimes you need to swap the bounds of integration before applying the fundamental theorem of calculus.

title: L'Hôpital's rule: limit at 0 example
description: Sal uses L'Hôpital's rule to find the limit at 0 of (2sinx-sin2x)/(x-sinx).

title: Intro to geometric transformations
description: Learn what the "image" of a transformations is, what are the rigid transformations, and which transformations are not rigid.

title: Determining rotations
description: Sal is given two pairs of line segments and a center of a dilation. He finds the angle for the rotation that maps one pair of segments to another.

title: Multiplying 2 fractions: fraction model
description: Sal uses a fraction model to multiply fractions.

title: Multiplying fractions and whole numbers 1
description: Sal uses two approaches to multiply 2/3x6.

title: More ways to multiply
description: Sal uses arrays and repeated addition to multiply.

title: Construct a right isosceles triangle
description: Can you build a triangle that is both a right triangle and an isosceles triangle?

title: Construct a triangle with constraints
description: Here's a challenge: in this problem we are given constraints and asked to construct a triangle. It can be done! You'll learn about degenerate triangles, too.

title: The Lost Colony of Roanoke - settlement and disappearance
description: Kim and David continue discussing the Lost Colony of Roanoke. What happened when the English colonists finally settled on the coast of North Carolina? What are the prevailing theories about what happened to the colonists?

title: The Lost Colony of Roanoke - background and first attempts
description: Kim and David discuss the mystery of the "Lost Colony" on Roanoke Island, the English settlement in North America that vanished in the late 1500s. In this video, they set the stage for the colonial venture and discuss the first two missions to Roanoke Island.

title: Early English settlements - Jamestown
description: Kim discusses how after many years of unsuccessful settlements, the English founded the colony of Jamestown in Virginia.

title: Jamestown - John Smith and Pocahontas
description: Kim discusses the early difficulties of the English colonists at Jamestown, and clears up some common misconceptions about John Smith and Pocahontas.

title: Jamestown - the impact of tobacco
description: Kim discusses how John Rolfe's discovery that Virginia was the perfect environment to cultivate tobacco led to Jamestown's success -- and to a great deal of conflict between the English and the Powhatans, resulting in the first and second Anglo-Powhatan Wars.

title: Jamestown - life and labor in the Chesapeake
description: Kim discusses how the tobacco plantation system led to indentured servitude and eventually slavery in the area surrounding Jamestown and the Chesapeake Bay.

title: Jamestown - Bacon's Rebellion
description: Kim discusses how the system of indentured servitude in colonial Virginia transformed into a system of African slavery after Nathaniel Bacon's rebellion against the House of Burgesses.

title: Intro to negative numbers
description: Mysterious negative numbers! What ARE they? They are numbers less than zero. If you understand the nature of below zero temperatures, you can understand negative numbers. We'll help.

title: Geometric definitions example
description: Watch Sal solve a problem where he matches three students definition of parallel lines to a teacher's comments.

title: Multiplying matrices by scalars
description: Sal defines what it means to multiply a matrix by a scalar (in the world of matrices, a scalar is simply a regular number).

title: Infinite series as limit of partial sums
description: Infinite series are defined as the limit of the infinite sequence of partial sums. Since we already know how to work with limits of sequences, this definition is really useful.

title: Similar shapes & transformations
description: Sal is given pairs of polygons, and then he determines whether they are similar by trying to map one onto the other using angle-preserving transformations.

title: Advanced (plural) possession
description: Paige and David talk about using apostrophes to show that something belongs to multiple people.

title: Ratio test
description: The ratio test is a most useful test for series convergence. It caries over intuition from geometric series to more general series. Learn more about it here.

title: Related rates: circle radius & area
description: What's the relationship between how fast a circle's radius changes, and how fast its area changes?

title: Exponential functions differentiation
description: Sal differentiates the exponential function 7^(x²-x) using our knowledge of the derivative of aˣ and the chain rule.

title: Adding decimals with ones and tenths parts
description: Sal uses an understanding of place value to add decimals, such as 4+5.7.

title: Introduction to adding decimals: tenths
description: Sal adds tenths, like 0.1+0.8 using visuals and place value.

title: Multiplying monomials by polynomials: area model
description: Sal expresses the area of a rectangle whose height is 4 and width is x²+3x+2.

title: Greatest common factor examples
description: Find the biggest number that will divide into the given 2 numbers. This is called the GCF or greatest common factor.No worries, we'll show you how to do it.

title: Greatest common factor explained
description: Here's a nice explanation of greatest common factor (or greatest common divisor) along with a few practice example exercises. Let's roll.

title: Pascal's triangle and binomial expansion
description: Sal introduces Pascal's triangle, and shows how we can use it to figure out the coefficients in binomial expansions.

title: Expanding binomials
description: Sal expands (3y^2+6x^3)^5 using the binomial theorem and Pascal's triangle.

title: Exponent properties with parentheses
description: Learn two exponent properties: (ab)^c and (a^b)^c. See WHY they work and HOW to use them.

title: Number of solutions to a system of equations algebraically
description: Sal solves several examples where he reasons about the number of solutions of systems of equations using algebraic reasoning.

title: Distance between point & line
description: The distance from a point to a line is the shortest distance between the point and any point on the line. This can be done with a variety of tools like slope-intercept form and the Pythagorean Theorem.

title: Distance formula
description: Learn how to find the distance between two points by using the distance formula, which is an application of the Pythagorean theorem.

title: Intro to order of operations
description: This example shows the steps and clarifies the purpose of order of operations: to have ONE way to interpret a mathematical statement.

title: Order of operations examples: exponents
description: Exponents are near the top of the food chain when it comes to order of operations. Let's do some examples together.

title: Subtracting decimals: 9.57-8.09
description: Sal subtracts 9.57-8.09 using "standard algorithm".

title: Subtracting decimals: 10.1-3.93
description: Sal subtracts 10.1-3.93 using "standard algorithm".

title: Converting units: minutes to hours
description: There are 60 minutes in 1 hour. To convert from minutes to hours, divide the number of minutes by 60. For example, 120 minutes equals 2 hours because 120/60=2.

title: Converting units: metric distance
description: Learn to order 1 decameter, 13 meters, 15,000 millimeters, and 1900 centimeters from least to greatest.

title: Converting units: centimeters to meters
description: Learn to convert 37 centimeters to meters.

title: Multiplying multi-digit numbers
description: Sal shows lots of examples for how to multiply  2- and 3-digit numbers using "standard algorithm".

title: Constructing a probability distribution for random variable
description: Sal breaks down how to create the probability distribution of the number of "heads" after 3 flips of a fair coin.

title: Evaluating expressions with two variables
description: We've done a few examples together where we were faced with 1 variable. Why not try one that has 2 variables?

title: Adding decimals with hundredths
description: Sal uses an understanding of place value to add decimals, such as 0.68+0.33.

title: Adding decimals with ones and tenths parts
description: Sal uses an understanding of place value to add decimals, such as 4+5.7.

title: Adding decimals with ones, tenths and hundredths
description: Sal adds numbers, such as 3.53+4.72, by breaking them down into place values.

title: Adding decimals: 9.087+15.31
description: Sal solves 9.087+15.31 using the "standard algorithm".

title: Adding decimals: 0.822+5.65
description: Sal solves 0.822+5.65 using "standard algorithm".

title: Adding three decimals
description: Sal adds 7.056+605.7+5.67 using the "standard algorithm".

title: Constructing numerical expressions
description: Sal solves a word problem by constructing a numerical expression.

title: Evaluating expressions with & without parentheses
description: Sal evaluates an expression with and without parentheses

title: Exponent properties with products
description: Learn how to simplify expressions like (5^6)/(5^2). Also learn how 1/(a^b) is the same as a^-b. Towards the end of the video, we practice simplifying more complex expressions like (25 * x * y^6)/(20 * y^5 * x^2).

title: Exponent properties with parentheses
description: Learn two exponent properties: (ab)^c and (a^b)^c. See WHY they work and HOW to use them.

title: Multiplying fractions word problem: muffins
description: Sal solves a word problem by multiplying 2 fractions.

title: Multiplying fractions word problem: bike
description: Sal solves a word problem by multiplying a fraction by a mixed number.

title: Multiplying fractions word problem: laundry
description: Sal solves a word problem by multiplying 2 fractions.

title: Worked example: Cube root of a negative number
description: Learn how to find the cube root of -512.

title: Dimensions of a cube from its volume
description: Learn how to find the side length of a cube whose volume is 512 cubic centimeters.

title: Derivatives of sin(x), cos(x), tan(x), eˣ & ln(x)
description: Learn the derivatives of several common functions.

title: Volume word problem: water tank
description: Sal using volume of a rectangular prism to solve a word problem.

title: Coordinate plane: graphing points
description: Sal graphs ordered pairs, such as (8, 10) in quadrant 1 on a coordinate plane.

title: Subtraction strategies with hundredths
description: Sal uses place value and decomposing numbers to subtract decimals, such as 65.79-42.58.

title: More advanced subtraction strategies with hundredths
description: Sal uses place value and numbers in expanded form to subtract decimal to hundredths, such as 8.38-4.54.

title: Prepositional phrases
description: Prepositional phrases are word chunks that begin with a preposition.

title: Converting a fraction to a repeating decimal
description: Learn how to rewrite 19/27 as a repeating decimal. What's a repeating decimal? THAT is a great question. This video explains.

title: Solving quadratics by taking square roots: with steps
description: Sal analyzes a given solution of a quadratic equation, and finds where and what was the error in that process.

title: Oxidation and reduction review from biological point-of-view
description: Taking a look at oxidation and reduction in a biological context.

title: Oxidation and reduction in cellular respiration
description: Oxidation and reduction in cellular respiration. Reconciling the biology and chemistry definitions of oxidation and reduction.

title: Cellular respiration introduction
description: Introduction to cellular respiration, including glycolysis, the Krebs Cycle, and the electron transport chain.

title: Overview of cellular respiration
description: Overview: glycolysis, pyruvate oxidation, the citric acid cycle (Krebs cycle), and oxidative phosphorylation.

title: Overview of glycolysis
description: Overview of the basics of glycolysis.

title: Steps of glycolysis
description: Introduction to glycolysis. Role of glycolysis in producing ATPs and NADHs and converting glucose to pyruvates.

title: Krebs / citric acid cycle
description: Overview of the Krebs or citric acid cycle, which is a series of reactions that takes in acetyl CoA and  produces carbon dioxide, NADH, FADH2, and ATP or GTP.

title: Oxidative phosphorylation and the electron transport chain
description: How oxidation of co-enzymes like NADH can lead to the production of ATP through oxidative phosphorylation.

title: Lactic acid fermentation
description: Lactic acid fermentation. How organisms like lactobacillus convert pyruvic acid to lactic acid and oxidize NADH to NAD+ in the process.

title: Alcohol or ethanol fermentation
description: Alcohol or ethanol fermentation, including yeast and its role in bread and wine production.

title: Introduction to 3d graphs
description: Three-dimensional graphs are a way to represent functions with a two-dimensional input and a one-dimensional output.

title: Interpreting graphs with slices
description: 3d graphs can be a lot to take in, but it helps to imagine slicing them with planes parallel to the x-axis or y-axis and relate them with two-dimensional graphs.

title: Contour plots
description: An alternative method to representing multivariable functions with a two-dimensional input and a one-dimensional output, contour maps involve drawing purely in the input space.

title: Parametric curves
description: When a function has a one-dimensional input, but a multidimensional output, you can think of it as drawing a curve in space.

title: Parametric surfaces
description: Functions that have a two-dimensional input and a three-dimensional output can be thought of as drawing a surface in three-dimensional space. This is actually pretty cool.

title: Vector fields, introduction
description: Vector fields let you visualize a function with a two-dimensional input and a two-dimensional output. You end up with, well, a field of vectors sitting at various points in two-dimensional space.

title: Fluid flow and vector fields
description: A neat way to interpret a vector field is to imagine that it represents some kind of fluid flow.

title: Transformations, part 1
description: One fun way to think about functions is to imagine that they literally move the points from the input space over to the output space. See what this looks like with some one-dimensional examples.

title: Transformations, part 2
description: More transformations, but this time with a function that maps two dimensions to two dimensions.

title: Multivariable functions
description: An introduction to multivariable functions, and a welcome to the multivariable calculus content as a whole.

title: Overview of cell signaling
description: Overview of cell signaling. Autocrine, paracrine and endocrine signaling.

title: Example of a signal transduction pathway
description: Illustrating the complexity of signal transduction with a MAPK pathway. How mutations in the pathway are linked to cancer.

title: Graphing two-variable inequalities
description: Sal graphs the inequality y<3x+5.

title: Distance formula
description: Learn how to find the distance between two points by using the distance formula, which is an application of the Pythagorean theorem.

title: Elements and atoms
description: How elements relate to atoms. The basics of how protons, electrons, and neutrons make up an atom.

title: Atomic number, mass number, and isotopes
description: How to use the atomic number and the mass number to represent different isotopes

title: Worked example: Identifying isotopes and ions
description: Identifying isotopes and ions from the number of electrons, protons and neutrons, and vice versa.

title: Visual representation of transformation from matrix
description: Sal finds the drawing that appropriately represents the effect of a given 2x2 transformation matrix on the plane.

title: Complex numbers & sum of squares factorization
description: Learn how expressions of the form x^2+y^2 can be factored into linear factors. This would not be possible without the aid of complex numbers!

title: Factoring sum of squares
description: Sal factors 36a^8+2b^6 as (6a^4-i*√2b^3)(6a^4+i*√2b).

title: Using the Polynomial Remainder Theorem: finding remainders
description: Sal finds the remainder of (-3x^3-4x^2+10x-7) divided by (x-2) using the PRT (Polynomial Remainder Theorem).

title: Using the Polynomial Remainder Theorem: checking factors
description: Sal checks whether (x-3) is a factor of (2x^4-11x^3+15x^2+4x-12) using the PRT (Polynomial Remainder Theorem).

title: Using the Polynomial Remainder Theorem: finding coefficients
description: Sal determines the value of coefficient c in p(x)=x^3+2x^2+cx+10, in order for (x-5) to be a factor of p. The key is using the PRT (Polynomial Remainder Theorem)!

title: Commas and introductory elements
description: In English, you use commas to separate introductory elements from the rest of a sentence. Find out how with David and Paige!

title: Plotting numbers on the complex plane
description: Sal shows how to plot various numbers on the complex plane.

title: Adding complex numbers
description: Sal adds (5+2i) and (3-7i) .

title: Subtracting complex numbers
description: Sal subtracts (6-18i) from (2-3i).

title: More on orbitals and electron configuration
description: How electron configuration is related to orbitals and the structure of the periodic table.

title: Electron configurations for the first period
description: Introduces aufbau principle, Pauli exclusion principle, and orbital notation. Writes out the quantum numbers for the electrons in H and He.

title: Electron configurations for the second period
description: Writes out quantum numbers for all elements of the second period. Introduces Hund's rule, and connects blocks in periodic table with electron configuration.

title: Electron configurations for the third and fourth periods
description: How to write the electron configurations for elements in the third and fourth periods of the periodic table. includes using noble gas notation.

title: Graphing proportional relationships: unit rate
description: Sal graphs the equation of a line that represents a proportional relationship given a unit rate.

title: Graphing proportional relationships from a table
description: Sal graphs the equation of a line that represents a proportional relationship given a table.

title: Graphing proportional relationships from an equation
description: Sal graphs the equation of a line that represents a proportional relationship given an equation.

title: Telling time with number line
description: Sal uses a number line to tell time and find the duration of an event.

title: Second derivatives (parametric functions)
description: Sal finds the second derivative of the function defined by the parametric equations x=3e²ᵗ and y=3³ᵗ-1.

title: Simplifying rational expressions: grouping
description: Sal simplifies and states the domain of (2x^2+13x+20)/(2x^2+17x+30).

title: Simplifying rational expressions: higher degree terms
description: Sal simplifies & states the domain of (x⁴+8x²+7)/(3x⁵-3x).

title: Simplifying rational expressions: two variables
description: Sal simplifies & states the domain of (5x²+20xy+20y²)/(x²-xy-6y²).

title: Intro to the Pythagorean theorem
description: Sal introduces the famous and super important Pythagorean theorem!

title: Intro to the Pythagorean theorem 2
description: Sal introduces the famous and super important Pythagorean theorem!

title: Pythagorean theorem example
description: Sal uses the Pythagorean theorem to find the height of a right triangle with a base of 9 and a hypotenuse of 14.

title: Determinant of a 3x3 matrix: standard method (1 of 2)
description: Sal shows the standard method for finding the determinant of a 3x3 matrix.

title: Determinant of a 3x3 matrix: shortcut method (2 of 2)
description: Sal shows a "shortcut" method for finding the determinant of a 3x3 matrix.

title: Categorical data example
description: Sal breaks down some categorical data on video games and violence.

title: Interpreting two-way tables
description: Learn how to read two-way tables.

title: Variation in a species
description: How variation can be introduced into a species.

title: Viruses
description: Introduction to viruses.

title: Scientific notation word problem: red blood cells
description: Vampires and math students want to know: How many red blood cells are in the a human body? We can find the answer using scientific notation.

title: Simplifying in scientific notation challenge
description: Sal simplifies a very hairy expression in scientific notation.

title: Multiplying & dividing in scientific notation
description: Learn how to simplify a multiplication and division expression using scientific notation. The expression in this problem is (7 * 10^5) / ((2 * 10^-2)(2.5 * 10^9)).

title: Cylinder volume & surface area
description: A cylinder's volume is π r² h, and its surface area is 2π r h + 2π r². Learn how to use these formulas to solve an example problem.

title: Volume of a cone
description: The formula for the volume of a cone is V=1/3hπr². Learn how to use this formula to solve an example problem.

title: Volume of a sphere
description: The formula for the volume of a sphere is V = 4/3 πr³. See the formula used in an example where we are given the diameter of the sphere.

title: y-intercept of tangent line example
description: A practice problem for finding the y-intercept of a tangent line to f(x) = 1/x

title: Equation of tangent line
description: Sal finds the equation of the line tangent to the curve y=eˣ/(2+x³) at the point (1,e/3).

title: Equation of normal line
description: Sal finds the equation of the line normal to the curve y=eˣ/x² at the point (1,e).

title: Analyzing rectilinear motion graphically
description: Learn how to analyze a particles motion given the graph of its position over time.

title: Rectilinear motion example: speeding up
description: The position of a particle moving along the x-axis is given by s(t)=t³-6t²+9t. Sal analyzes it to find the times when the particle is "speeding up."

title: Critical points introduction
description: Sal introduces the "critical points" of a function and discusses their relationship with the extremum points of the function.

title: Finding critical points
description: Sal finds the critical points of f(x)=xe^(-2x²).

title: Testing critical points for local extrema
description: Once you find a critical point, how can you tell if it is a minimum, maximum or neither?

title: Inequalities with variables on both sides
description: Sal solves the inequality -3p-7<p+9, draws the solution on a number line and checks a few values to verify the solution.

title: Inequalities with variables on both sides (with parentheses)
description: Sal solves the inequality 5x+7>3(x+1), draws the solution on a number line and checks a few values to verify the solution.

title: Multi-step inequalities
description: Sal solves several multi-step linear inequalities.

title: More than one equal section
description: Sal uses fractions to name parts of a whole.

title: Recognizing fractions greater than 1
description: Lindsay uses fraction models to identify a fraction greater than 1.

title: Volume with fractional cubes
description: Another way of finding the volume of a rectangular prism involves dividing it into fractional cubes, finding the volume of one, and then multiplying that volume by the number of cubes that fit into our rectangular prism.

title: Volume of a rectangular prism: fractional dimensions
description: Learn how to find the volume of a rectangular prism that has fractional side lengths. The prism in this video has dimensions 3/5 by 1 1/6 by 3/7.

title: Shifting & reflecting functions
description: Sal walks through several examples of how to write g(x) implicitly in terms of f(x) when g(x) is a shift or a reflection of f(x).

title: Compressing functions
description: Given the graphs of functions f and g, where g is the result of compressing f by a factor of 2, Sal finds g(x) in terms of f(x).

title: Reflecting & compressing functions
description: Given the graphs of functions f and g, where g is the result of reflecting & compressing f by a factor of 3, Sal finds g(x) in terms of f(x).

title: One-step inequalities: -5c ≤ 15
description: In addition to solving the inequality, we'll graph the solution. Remember to swap if you mutiply both sides of the inequality by a negative number.

title: One-step inequalities examples
description: Our discussion of linear inequalities begins with multiplying and dividing by negative numbers. Listen closely for the word "swap." Super important!

title: One-step inequality word problem
description: Inequalities are more than abstract concepts and exercises. They help solve real life problems. Here's an example.

title: Exponents with negative bases
description: Learn to what we know about negative numbers to determine how negative bases with exponents are affected and what patterns develop. Also learn how order of operations affect the pattern.

title: Multiplying positive and negative fractions
description: See examples of multiplying and dividing fractions with negative numbers.

title: Volume of triangular prism & cube
description: Using the formulas for the volume of triangular prism and cube to solve some solid geometry problems.

title: Cylinder volume & surface area
description: A cylinder's volume is π r² h, and its surface area is 2π r h + 2π r². Learn how to use these formulas to solve an example problem.

title: Volume of a sphere
description: The formula for the volume of a sphere is V = 4/3 πr³. See the formula used in an example where we are given the diameter of the sphere.

title: Linear & nonlinear functions: table
description: Learn to determine if a table of values represents a linear function.

title: Linear & nonlinear functions: word problem
description: Learn to determine if the relationship described in a word problem is a function.

title: Linear & nonlinear functions: missing value
description: Learn to find the missing value in a table to make sure it represents a linear equation.

title: Newton's first law of motion concepts
description: A little quiz on some of the ideas in Newton's first law

title: Newton's second law of motion
description: Newton's second law of motion is F = ma, or force is equal to mass times acceleration. Learn how to use the formula to calculate acceleration.

title: More on Newton's second law
description: In this video David explains how to use Newton's second law when dealing with multiple forces, forces in two dimensions, and diagonal forces.

title: More on Newton's third law
description: In this video David explains some of the common misconceptions in dealing with Newton's Third Law. He also shows how to correctly and reliably identify Third Law force pairs.

title: Normal force in an elevator
description: How the normal force changes when an elevator accelerates

title: The force of tension
description: David explains what the force of tension is, how to solve for it, and some common misconceptions involving the force of tension.

title: Static and kinetic friction example
description: Thinking about the coefficients of static and kinetic friction

title: Inclined plane force components
description: Figuring out the components of the force due to gravity that are parallel and perpendicular to the surface of an inclined plane

title: Conservation of Charge
description: Charge can't be created, and it can't be destroyed

title: Coulomb's Law
description: Sal explains the fundamental force that causes charged particles to attract or repel each other

title: Electric field direction
description: The direction of an electrical field at a point is the same as the direction of the electrical force acting on a positive test charge at that point. For example, if you place a positive test charge in an electric field and the charge moves to the right, you know the direction of the electric field in that region points to the right.

title: Net electric field from multiple charges in 1D
description: In this video David solves an example problem to find the net electric field created by multiple charges at a point in between them.

title: Net electric field from multiple charges in 2D
description: In this video David solves an example 2D electric field problem to find the net electric field at a point above two charges.

title: Electric potential energy of charges
description: In this video David explains how to find the electric potential energy for a system of charges and solves an example problem to find the speed of moving charges. To see the calculus derivation of the formula watch this video.

title: Electric potential charge configuration
description: In this video David shows how to find the total electric potential at a point in space due to multiple charges.

title: Simplifying exponential expressions
description: Sal simplifies the expression 10*9^(0.5t+2)*5^(3t) as 810*375^t.

title: Proof: Right triangles inscribed in circles
description: Proof showing that a triangle inscribed in a circle having a diameter as one side is a right triangle

title: Inscribed shapes: angle subtended by diameter
description: One method using an inscribed angle intercepting a diameter of a circle.

title: Inscribed shapes: find inscribed angle
description: Using either the inscribed angle theorem or the fact that two inscribed angles that intercept the same arc must be congruent.

title: Inscribed shapes: find diameter
description: Find the diameter of a circle using an inscribed right triangle.

title: Worked example: arithmetic series (sigma notation)
description: Sal evaluates the arithmetic series Σ(2k+50) for k=1 to 550. He does that using the arithmetic series formula (a₁+aₙ)*n/2.

title: Worked example: arithmetic series (sum expression)
description: Sal evaluates the arithmetic sum (-50)+(-44)+(-38)+...+2044. He does that by finding the number of terms and using the arithmetic series formula (a₁+aₙ)*n/2.

title: Worked example: arithmetic series (recursive formula)
description: Sal evaluates the sum of the first 650 terms in the sequence defined recursively as {aᵢ=aᵢ₋₁+11, a₁=4}. He does that by finding the 650th term and using the arithmetic series formula (a₁+aₙ)*n/2.

title: Constructing exponential models
description: Sal models the distribution of a chain letter using an exponential function.

title: Constructing exponential models: half life
description: Sal models the decay of a Carbon-14 sample using an exponential function.

title: Constructing exponential models: percent change
description: Sal models a population of narwhals using an exponential function.

title: Thermal conduction, convection, and radiation
description: Fire as thermal conduction, convection, and radiation

title: Thermodynamics part 1: Molecular theory of gases
description: Intuition of how gases generate pressure in a container and why pressure x volume is proportional to the combined kinetic energy of the molecules in the volume.

title: More on internal energy
description: Getting more intuition of internal energy, heat, and work. Examples of using the first law to calculate work.

title: PV-diagrams and expansion work
description: Why work from expansion is the area under the curve of a PV-diagram. Why heat is not a state function and internal energy is a state function.

title: Efficiency of a Carnot engine
description: Definition of efficiency for a heat engine.  Efficiency of a Carnot Engine.

title: Specific heat and latent heat of fusion and vaporization
description: Defining specific heat, heat of fusion, and heat of vaporization. How to calculate the amount of heat to change the temperature of water and the energy required to change for a phase change.

title: Maxwell Boltzmann distribution
description: Using the Maxwell-Boltzmann distribution to visualize the distribution of speeds of particles at different temperatures.

title: Introduction to verb tense
description: An understanding of verb tense will make you into a TIME WIZARD, with the ability to control the past, the present, and the future – with your words, anyway.

title: Marginal distribution and conditional distribution
description: Marginal distribution and conditional distribution

title: Fundamentals: Introduction to Critical Thinking
description:
Geoff Pynn gets you started on the critical thinking journey. He tells you what critical thinking is, what an argument is, and what the difference between a deductive and an ampliative argument is. 

Speaker: Dr. Geoff Pynn, Assistant Professor, Northern Illinois University

title: Second Law of Thermodynamics
description: The Second Law of Thermodynamics: there can be no spontaneous transfer of heat from cold to hot.

title: Overview of cellular respiration
description: Overview: glycolysis, pyruvate oxidation, the citric acid cycle (Krebs cycle), and oxidative phosphorylation.

title: Photosynthesis
description: Overview of photosynthesis. What photosynthesis accomplishes, why it's important, and how the light-dependent and light-independent reactions work together.

title: Hydrogen bonding in water
description: Hydrogen bonding in water.

title: Water as a solvent
description: Water as a solvent. Polar solutes. Hydrophilic and hydrophobic substances.

title: Adding & subtracting multiple polynomials
description: Sal simplifies (x³ + 3x - 6) + (-2x² + x - 2) - (3x - 4).

title: Corresponding angles in congruent triangles
description: We write the letters of congruent triangles so their order tells us which parts of corresponding. In this video, Sal uses this notation to solve some angles.

title: Understanding place value when adding ones
description: Sal adds 37 + 2 by thinking about place value.

title: Understanding place value when adding tens
description: Sal adds 23 + 30 by thinking about place value.

title: Intro to reflective symmetry
description: Introduction to the concept of an "axis of symmetry"

title: Identifying symmetrical figures
description: Lindsay identifies lines of symmetry on three shapes.

title: Exponential vs. linear growth
description: For constant increments in x, a linear growth would increase by a constant difference, and an exponential growth would increase by a constant ratio.

title: Modeling with function combination
description: Sal models the height of a tower on top of a tree, by adding the functions that model the growth of the tower and the tree in separate.

title: Two-way frequency tables and Venn diagrams
description: Sal uses a Venn diagram to introduce two-way frequency tables.

title: Slope-intercept equation from graph
description: Learn to write equations in slope-intercept form for three different lines.

title: Making a scale drawing
description: An urban planner needs your help in creating a scale drawing. Let's use our knowledge about scale factor, length, and area to assist.

title: Absolute value of complex numbers
description: Sal finds the absolute value of (3-4i).

title: Converting from slope-intercept to standard form
description: Sal converts the slope-intercept equation y=2/3x+4/7 to standard form.

title: Interpreting change in exponential models
description: Sal finds the factor by which a quantity changes over a single time unit in various exponential models.

title: Domain and range of quadratic functions
description: Sal finds the domain and the range of f(x)=3x^2+6x-2.

title: Analyzing polynomial identities
description: Sal considers two cases of polynomial identities and their proofs.

title: Multiplying monomials by polynomials challenge
description: Sal finds the values of coefficients c, d, and f that make -2y(y²+cy-3)=dy³+12y²+fy true for all y-values.

title: Constraining solutions of systems of inequalities
description: Given the graph of a system of inequalities, Sal finds the x-values that make the ordered pair (x,-2) a solution of the system.

title: Finding composite functions
description: Given that f(x)=√(x²-1) and g(x)=x/(1+x), Sal finds f(g(x)) and g(f(x)).

title: Intro to function symmetry
description: Sal explains what it means for a function to be even, odd, or neither, both algebraically and graphically.

title: Graphical symmetry of functions
description: Sal picks the function that is odd among three functions given by their graphs.

title: Amplitude & period of sinusoidal functions from equation
description: Sal finds the amplitude and the period of y=-0.5cos(3x).

title: Solving quadratics by taking square roots: strategy
description: Sal discusses the exact order of steps in the process of solving the equation 3(x+6)^2=75.

title: Graphing quadratics: standard form
description: Learn how to graph any quadratic function that is given in standard form. Here, Sal graphs y=5x²-20x+15.

title: Solving quadratic equations: complex roots
description: Sal solves the equation 2x^2+5=6x using the quadratic formula, and finds that the solutions are complex numbers.

title: Parabolas intro
description: Graphs of quadratic functions all have the same shape which we call "parabola." All parabolas have shared characteristics. For example, they are all symmetric about a line that passes through their vertex. This video covers this and other basic facts about parabolas.

title: Emphatic pronouns
description: Sometimes we use reflexive pronouns like "myself" and "ourselves" for emphasis in a sentence, like, "If you won't help me, then I'll do it myself!" KA's Grammar Fellow, David, explains this usage.

title: Decimals as words
description: Sal writes 0.17  and 40.03 in words.  He also writes twenty-four hundredths using numbers.

title: Dividing fractions by whole numbers: studying
description: Learn to solve a word problem that involves dividing a unit fraction by a whole number.

title: Writing basic expressions word problems
description: Learn how to write basic expressions with variables to describe situations described in word problems.

title: Recognizing angles
description: Sal identifies acute, obtuse, and right angles in diagrams and pictures.

title: Intro to nets of polyhedra
description: Admittedly, "nets of polyhedra" sounds like the title of a bad sci-fi movie about man-eating, multi-headed fish. But in reality, nets of polyhedra are just 2D objects that wrap around 3D objects, like wrapping paper around presents.

title: Measuring volume as area times length
description: Sal transitions from measuring volume with unit cubes to multiplying area times length.

title: Solving problems with pictographs 2
description: Sal uses picture graphs to solve word problems.

title: Coordinate plane: graphing points
description: Sal graphs ordered pairs, such as (8, 10) in quadrant 1 on a coordinate plane.

title: Dividing decimals with hundredths
description: Decimal divisors in the hundredths place can be a little confusing. In this video we'll show you how to move the decimal and make it a whole number. Pretty nifty! Watch.

title: Dividing decimals completely
description: Sal shows how to divide 6.3 by 0.25.

title: Long division with decimals
description: Sal divides 6.7 by 2.211.

title: Dividing by a multi-digit decimal
description: Sal shows that when there is a decimal divisor, you need to shift the decimal first and then divide.

title: Dividing decimals with hundredths example 3
description: Sal shows how to  tackle a division problem step by step when there is a decimal divisor.

title: Ionic, covalent, and metallic bonds
description: There are three major types of chemical bonds: ionic, covalent, and metallic. Ionic bonds form due to the transfer of an electron from one atom to another. Covalent bonds involve the sharing of electrons between two atoms. Metallic bonds are formed by the attraction between metal ions and delocalized, or "free" electrons.

title: Electronegativity
description: Defines electronegativity and compares to electron affinity. Explains group and period trends in electronegativity using atomic radii.

title: Electronegativity and bonding
description: Electronegativity differences in bonding using the Pauling scale. Classifying bonds as covalent, polar covalent, or ionic.

title: Intermolecular forces
description: Different types of intermolecular forces (forces between molecules).

title: Chemical reactions introduction
description: Reactants and products in reversible and irreversible chemical reactions.

title: Exponential model word problem: medication dissolve
description: Sal solves an exponential equation in order to answer a question about an exponential model.

title: Exponential model word problem: bacteria growth
description: Sal evaluates an exponential function at a specific value in order to answer a question about an exponential model.

title: Photosynthesis
description: Overview of photosynthesis. What photosynthesis accomplishes, why it's important, and how the light-dependent and light-independent reactions work together.

title: Photosynthesis: Overview of the light-dependent reactions
description: Overview of the light-dependent reactions, including the structure of the chloroplast, the photosystems, and how ATP is synthesized.

title: Photosynthesis:  Calvin cycle
description: The Calvin cycle, or the light-independent (dark) reactions of photosythesis.

title: Photorespiration
description: The Calvin cycle and a competing pathway called photorespiration (also initiated by Rubisco).

title: C4 photosynthesis
description: C4 photosynthesis: how some plants avoid photorespiration.

title: CAM plants
description: How CAM Plants are able to fix carbon at night so they don't have to keep their stomata open during the day.

title: Hershey and Chase: DNA is the genetic material
description: How Alfred Hershey and Martha Chase showed conclusively that DNA is the genetic material.

title: Molecular structure of DNA
description: Molecular structure of DNA. Nucleotide. Nitrogenous base, phosphate.

title: Antiparallel structure of DNA strands
description: DNA is composed of two strands of nucleotides held together by hydrogen bonding. The strands each run from 5' to 3' and run in antiparallel, or opposite, directions from one another.

title: Surface area of a cuboid
description: Surface area is the sum of the areas of all faces (or surfaces) on a 3D shape. A cuboid has 6 rectangular faces. To find the surface area of a cuboid, add the areas of all 6 faces. We can also label the length (l), width (w), and height (h) of the prism and use the formula, SA=2lw+2lh+2hw, to find the surface area.

title: Surface area of a box using nets
description: Learn how to find the surface area of cereal box using nets.

title: Surface area using a net: rectangular prism
description: A polyhedron is a three-dimensional shape that has flat surfaces and straight edges.  Learn whether or not a certain net could be folded up into a certain rectangular prism.

title: Surface area using a net: triangular prism
description: Learn how to compute the surface area of a triangular prism.

title: Introduction to singular and plural nouns
description: Learn the difference between singular and plural nouns.

title: Three ways to end a sentence
description: David and Paige, KA’s resident grammarians, introduce the three ways to end a sentence: the period, the exclamation point, and the question mark.

title: Subject and object pronouns
description: Before we get any further with pronouns, let's cover what the difference between a subject and an object pronoun is, because the distinction between those two concepts will start coming up a good deal.

title: Multiplying with area model: 6 x 7981
description: Sal uses an area model to multiply 6x7981.

title: Variance of a population
description: Variance as a measure of, on average, how far the data points in a population are from the population mean

title: Sample variance
description: Thinking about how we can estimate the variance of a population by looking at the data in a sample.

title: Review and intuition why we divide by n-1 for the unbiased sample variance
description: Reviewing the population mean, sample mean, population variance, sample variance and building an intuition for why we divide by n-1 for the unbiased sample variance

title: Titration introduction
description: Introduction to acid-base titrations using example of titrating 20.0 mL of HCl of unknown concentration with 0.100 M NaOH. Covers indicators, endpoint, equivalence point, and calculating the unknown concentration.

title: Titration calculation example
description: Example of titrating strong acid, hydrochloric acid, with strong base barium hydroxide. How to calculate the unknown concentration when you don't have a 1:1 molar ratio of H+ to OH-.

title: Titration of a strong acid with a strong base
description: In a strong acid-strong base titration, the acid and base will react to form a neutral solution. At the equivalence point of the reaction, hydronium (H+) and hydroxide (OH-) ions will react to form water, leading to a pH of 7. This is true of all strong acid-strong base titrations. An example of this would be the titration of hydrochloric acid (strong acid) and sodium hydroxide (strong base) to form sodium chloride and water.

title: Titration of a strong acid with a strong base (continued)
description: Calculating the pH at and after the equivalence point for titration of strong acid, hydrochloric acid, with strong base, NaOH.
